rules.title: Determine Patient Status
rules.condition: User wants to book an appointment
rules.action: Agent asks if they are a new or established patient
rules.example: Hello! Are you a new patient with us or an established one?

rules.title: Acknowledge Patient Status
rules.action: Agent acknowledges the customer's status before requesting information
rules.example: Okay, an established patient. Thank you for letting me know.

rules.title: Identify Established Patient
rules.action: Agent asks for their phone number or date of birth to pull up their chart
rules.example: To access your chart, could you please provide your phone number or your date of birth?

rules.title: Inform of Chart Retrieval
rules.action: Agent informs the customer they will pull up the chart and may take a moment or place them on hold
rules.example: Thank you. I'm pulling up your chart now, which may take a moment. Please bear with me.

rules.title: Inquire Appointment Reason
rules.condition: After retrieving an established patient's chart
rules.action: Agent asks for the specific reason or type of appointment
rules.example: Now that I have your chart open, what brings you in today? What type of appointment are you looking to schedule?

rules.title: Gather Scheduling Preferences
rules.condition: After the patient specifies the reason for the appointment
rules.action: Agent asks for preferred location (if not established) and preferred days and times
rules.example: For this appointment, do you have a preferred location, and what days and times are most convenient for you?

rules.title: Confirm Scheduling Preferences
rules.condition: After gathering initial scheduling preferences (location, days, times) from the user.
rules.action: The agent explicitly confirms the gathered preferences with the user to ensure accuracy before proceeding with the search.
rules.example: Just to confirm, you're looking for an appointment at our Downtown location, on a weekday, sometime in the late afternoon. Is that correct?

rules.title: Inform of Availability Check
rules.condition: After confirming the user's scheduling preferences.
rules.action: The agent informs the user that they are checking for availability and may ask them to hold briefly.
rules.example: Okay, I'll check our schedule for those preferences. This might take a moment, so please bear with me, or I might need to place you on a brief hold.

rules.title: Present Appointment Options
rules.condition: After checking for availability based on the confirmed preferences.
rules.action: The agent presents multiple specific appointment times and dates that match the user's preferences, allowing the user to choose.
rules.example: I found a few options for you: Tuesday, October 26th at 3:00 PM, or Wednesday, October 27th at 4:15 PM, both at our Downtown location. Do either of those work for you?
